meanings.definition: Search for and collect (anything usable) from discarded waste.
meanings.sent1: The raccoon was scavenging through the trash for food.
meanings.sent2: The vulture was scavenging for carrion in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was scavenging for acorns in the park's garbage bin.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur was scavenging for new business ideas in old magazines.
meanings.sent5: The child was scavenging for hidden treasures in the attic.

meanings.definition: Feed on dead or decaying matter.
meanings.sent1: The hyena was scavenging on the remains of a wildebeest.
meanings.sent2: The crow was scavenging on roadkill by the highway.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scavenging on the leftovers in the garbage can.
meanings.sent4: The bacteria were scavenging on the decaying plant matter.
meanings.sent5: The vulture was scavenging on the carcass of a deer.
